new_product.line1: We believe that freshly baked bread on a Sunday is a basic human right.

hero.subtitle: We have been baking bread in K√•lltorp since 2014. Every loaf is filled with love, shaped by hand, and baked in a stone oven with locally selected ingredients.

info.contact_description: Do you have questions about orders or our products? Feel free to get in touch!
info.location_description: In the heart of K√•lltorp, right by Solrosgatan. Street parking is available.

hero.description: Lilla Sur is a craft bakery in K√•lltorp driven by a passion for real bread ‚Äì the kind of bread our ancestors ate.

story.subtitle: Creating a legacy
story.title: Lilla Sur's story
story.p1: A craft bakery in the heart of K√•lltorp. Real bread. Real people. Real taste. Lilla Sur was founded in 2014 by bread enthusiasts Andreas and Tommy and has since been a symbol of quality, community, and service. A decade later, Beata and Sid are taking Lilla Sur to new heights. Same quality. Same community. More love. More adventure.
story.p2: Beata has loved sourdough bread for as long as she can remember. The smell of freshly baked sourdough takes her right back to her childhood days in Poland. Beata has lived and worked in Asia, Europe, and the USA, gathering experiences and flavors from all corners of the world. Along the way, she met Sid. Sid has been playing with dough even before he learned to walk. An engineer by craft and an artist at heart, Sid built cars at Volvo before deciding to pursue what he is truly passionate about. Wake and bake.
story.p3: Together with a team of talented bakers, Beata and Sid promise to pamper the people of Gothenburg with bread and buns of the highest taste and quality. Baked at Lilla Sur.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: Every decision we make is guided by our fundamental values ‚Äì from the choice of ingredients to how we treat our customers.

quality.title: Uncompromising Quality
quality.description: Like a well-kneaded dough, nothing is rushed and nothing is tolerated if it‚Äôs subpar. From flour selection to final bake, every step is held to a standard where shortcuts would weaken the structure and flavour of the bread.

customer.title: Customer Obsessed
customer.description: A loaf is shaped for the hands and palate that will break it open. Crust, crumb, and aroma are tuned to the experience of the person eating it, the way dough is shaped around the needs of its final form.

clean.title: Clean Eating, Scandi Minimalism
clean.description: Only the clean, necessary ingredients go into the mix. Just as a pure dough relies on flour, water, salt, and time, the focus is on clarity, lightness, and ingredients you can recognise and trust.

craft.title: Craft over Convenience
craft.description: Slow fermentation over instant yeast, handwork over automation. Like letting dough rise naturally, patience and technique are chosen over speed to build deeper flavour and character.

less.title: Less, but Better
less.description: Fewer varieties, perfected deeply. Each bread is refined again and again, the way repeated folds strengthen dough, until simplicity turns into excellence.

magic.title: Method meets Magic
magic.description: Precise ratios and temperatures create the conditions, but the oven spring and blistered crust still feel like alchemy. Thoughtful scoring guides how each loaf opens, and intentional shaping turns living dough into edible art. Solid technique invites the beautiful unpredictability of fermentation.

process.title: Our Process
process.description: From sourdough to finished bread ‚Äì a journey that takes up to 72 hours.

sourdough.title: The Sourdough
sourdough.description: Our sourdough is over 10 years old and is fed daily with fresh flour.

fermentation.title: Fermentation
fermentation.description: The dough ferments slowly in the cold to develop flavor and texture.

shaping.title: Shaping
shaping.description: Every loaf is gently shaped by hand for perfect structure.

baking.title: Baking
baking.description: In the stone oven, the bread gets its crispy crust and golden color.

cta.title: Come and Taste the Difference
cta.description: The best way to understand what we do is to taste for yourself. Visit us in the store or order online for pickup.

hero.subtitle: Welcome
hero.title: Contact
hero.description: Do you have questions, concerns, or just want to say hello? We are here for you.

map_placeholder.title: Find Us
map_placeholder.description: We are located at Solrosgatan 11 in K√•lltorp, easily accessible by tram or bus.

tips.title: Tips for your visit
items: ‚Ä¢ Parking is available along the street
‚Ä¢ Popular breads may sell out early ‚Äì come on time!
‚Ä¢ We accept cards, Swish, and cash

info.contact_subtitle: We reply as soon as we can

corporate.question: Can I order for corporate events?
corporate.answer: Absolutely! We accept larger orders for companies, parties, and events. Contact us via email at least one week in advance and we will help you.

gluten.question: Do you have gluten-free options?
gluten.answer: Unfortunately, we do not bake gluten-free at the moment as we work with flour throughout the premises. However, our oat loaves naturally contain less gluten thanks to long fermentation.

shelf_life.question: How long does the bread last?
shelf_life.answer: Our sourdough bread stays fresh for 3-5 days at room temperature, wrapped in a kitchen towel. You can also freeze it ‚Äì slice it first for easy thawing.

reserve.question: Can I reserve bread?
reserve.answer: Yes! Use our online ordering. We recommend ordering at least one day in advance, especially for weekends.

closed_days.question: Why is the shop closed Sunday and Monday?
closed_days.answer: We need time to prepare and bake for the week. Sourdough bread takes time ‚Äì our doughs ferment for up to 48 hours. And everyone needs to rest!

hero.subtitle: Our Range
hero.title: Products
hero.description: All our products are baked daily with 100% organic and KRAV-certified Swedish flour. Choose from sourdough bread, buns, cookies, and other treats.
